body: Updated with the suggested refactor. I ended up not moving the "disable if pre-execution-hook failed" logic to `ActionSandboxManager` because it is tied to a specific kind of async handler (individual recipes can fail without stopping other recipes or the post-execution-hook) and fits better with `RecipeRunner`'s purpose anyway. Reusing the managers should help with memory/performance, and I like the new API for `ActionSandboxManager` anyway.
